title: Foundation: A/Ls and General Psychology Degree
description: Any A/L stream is acceptable, but a background in Biology or Arts can be helpful. The first crucial step is to complete a Bachelor's degree (BA or BSc) in Psychology. This provides the foundational knowledge of psychological theories and research methods.

title: Postgraduate Diploma in Counseling
description: To become a counselor, a postgraduate diploma is often the next step. This provides practical skills and supervised training in counseling techniques, ethics, and different therapeutic approaches.

title: Master's Degree for Specialization (Psychologist Path)
description: To practice as a Psychologist (especially a clinical psychologist), a Master's degree (MA/MSc) is mandatory. This involves advanced coursework, a research thesis, and a significant supervised clinical internship.

title: Practicing Counselor or Psychologist
description: Work in a professional setting. Counselors often work in schools, NGOs, or private practices focusing on general wellness and coping strategies. Clinical Psychologists work in hospitals and clinics, diagnosing and treating mental health disorders.

title: Senior Psychologist / Private Practice / Academia
description: With significant experience, you can become a senior psychologist in a hospital, lead a mental health unit, or establish a thriving private practice. A PhD is required for a career in academia (lecturing and research).
institutes: N/A - Based on experience and further education
